ETYMOLOGY: From Latin tropicus 'of or belonging to a turn or turning point', from Greek tropikos 'of a turn, of the solstice', from tropos 'turn'. Related to the turning point of the sun at the solstices.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Either of the two imaginary circles around the Earth, parallel to the equator at 23.5° north (Tropic of Cancer) or south (Tropic of Capricorn) latitude, marking the boundaries of the tropical zone where the sun is directly overhead at least once a year.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 地球上两条假想的纬线之一，位于赤道以北（北回归线）或以南（南回归线）23.5°，标志着热带的边界，太阳每年至少一次直射其上。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The Tropic of Capricorn passes through Australia.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 南回归线穿过澳大利亚。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Plural noun: A noun that denotes more than one person, place, thing, or idea.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The region of the Earth lying between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn, characterized by a hot, often humid climate.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 地球上位于北回归线和南回归线之间的区域，气候炎热潮湿。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many exotic fruits grow only in the tropics.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多异国水果只能在热带地区生长。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to or characteristic of the tropics; tropical. (Often replaced by 'tropical' in modern usage).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与热带地区有关的；热带的。（现代用法中常被'tropical'替代）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Botanists study the unique flora of tropic regions.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 植物学家研究热带地区独特的植物群。
